tn.ref: In the ninth year and tenth month of Zedekiah king of Judah
tn.text: This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of December and the first part of January on Western calendars. AT: "In the tenth month of the ninth year that Zedekiah was king of Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])
See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]]

tn.ref: In the eleventh year and fourth month of Zedekiah, on the ninth day of the month
tn.text: This is the fourth month of the Hebrew calendar. The eleventh day is near the beginning of July on Western calendars. AT: "On the ninth day of the fourth month of the eleventh year that Zedekiah was king." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])

tn.ref: Nergal Sharezer, Samgar Nebo, and Sarsechim
tn.text: These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"in the middle entrance to the city." It was common for leaders to sit at the gate of the city to discuss important matters.

tn.ref: They went out at night from the city by the king's garden path
tn.text: "They left the city at night going out on a path in the king's garden"

tn.ref: the plains of the Jordan River valley
tn.text: This is the flat land at the southern end of the valley.

tn.ref: at Riblah in the land of Hamath
tn.text: Riblah was a town in the territory of Hamath. They are in Syria. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"followed and caught"
"decided how to punish him"
AT: "as he watched them do it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"the king's men made Zedekiah blind" or "the king's men blinded Zedekiah"
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Nebuchadnezzar's guards"

tn.ref: the rest of the people who were left in the city
tn.text: "the people remaining in the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"sent men out to get Jeremiah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"among the people who remained in Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
This story happened before the events in the first part of the chapter.
This marks a new section of the story.

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh had come to Jeremiah ... he said
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke to Jeremiah. He said"
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:38:07|38:7]].

tn.ref: I am about to carry out my words against this city for disaster and not for good
tn.text: "I am bringing disaster against this city just as I said I would"

tn.ref: For they will all come true before you on that day
tn.text: "For you will see it all happen on that day"
Yahweh continues speaking to Jeremiah.
This refers to the day the Babylonians break through the walls of Jerusalem to destroy the city.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: you will not be put into the hand of the men whom you fear
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to power or control. AT: "the men you fear will not harm you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You will not fall by the sword
tn.text: AT: "No one will kill you with their sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: You will escape with your life, since you trust in me
tn.text: "Your reward for trusting me is not being killed"
